b'I live in a 38 sqm apartment, where the distance from my bed to my \xe2\x80\x9coffice\xe2\x80\x9d is only a few steps apart. I try to go outside and walk as often as I can, but it is not nearly often enough. Some days I can have less than 100 steps in total, and other days 15,000. Last week, we got encouraged to join in on a challenge to walk an average of 10,000 steps everyday till December 17th, and it is for a good cause. The total amount of steps we walk, will be donated to the non-profit organization Right to Play, which mission is to protect, educate and empower children to rise above adversity using the power of play. I can\xe2\x80\x99t think of a better motivation to start walking more! b'I love to read, so I thought we could have a Tuesday #instabookclub. Here are 5 of my favorite recent reads for business and life. Share 5 of your favs in the comments. #dentsudiaries

1. The Culture Code \xe2\x80\x94 #danielcoyle\xe2\x80\x99s brilliant and helpful read on how to build and fuel culture in organizations.

2. How to be an Antiracist \xe2\x80\x94 one of the most powerful and important books I\xe2\x80\x99ve read, @ibramxk teaches and illustrates through his own life journey.

3. The Checklist Manifesto \xe2\x80\x94 @atul.gawande shows the power and at times lifesaving impact of a simple checklist in our hectic work and lives.

4. Our Time is Now \xe2\x80\x94 for those particularly in the U.S. an illuminating read by the incomparable @staceyabrams on voter suppression and protecting democracy.

5. Salvage the Bones \xe2\x80\x94 my favorite fiction read this year @jesmynward had me gripped in this haunting story of everyday survival in rural poverty.'

b'I filmed my 11 tips for working from home videos during the first week of the quarantine \xe2\x80\x93 but some things are easier said than done, and I have not been following them myself, when I really should have.

I have decided to give meditation a go, discovered that Matthew McConaughey\xe2\x80\x99s voice is the best sleep remedy I\xe2\x80\x99ve ever tried. b"My 11 tips for working from home:

1. Establish physical workspace boundaries at home between your work area and other activities
2. Set background noise to what works for you - e.g. music, white noise, grey noise, silence\xe2\x80\xa6
3. Create space between people in your house - invest into a pair of good noise cancelling headphones if you can
4. Have a routine! Even if it's just getting out of bed at the same time or making a cup of coffee
5. Stay organised - plan your work as well as breaks
6. Communicate more than before with your colleagues and use video camera in your catch ups to make it more personal
7. Have regular check-ins on workload, offer support or ask for help when you need it
8. Don't forget to move! Take extra time to incorporate exercise into your routine - go for a run, do yoga in your living room, or join one of the many available free online dance classes
9. Do go outside (if you still can) for some extra vitamin D - try working from your balcony or garden if you have one
10. Eat well and stay hydrated - take the time to look up a new recipe or what to do with the ingredients you already have in the house
11. Use your spare time to do what you have always wanted to do, but have been telling yourself that you don't have the time for it* *and if you find yourself still not doing it - guess you can cross that item out of your wishlist for good!

Have I missed anything - what tips have you got to share with me?
